0.caption: University of North Carolina boys in their car in front of the post office in Chapel Hill, North Carolina, 1940.

1.caption: University of North Carolina boys in their car in front of the post office in Chapel Hill, North Carolina, 1940.

2.caption: University of North Carolina - Chapel Hill's Wilson Library, which opened in 1929.

3.caption: A formal portrait of  William 'Bill' T. Couch.

4.caption: Families migrating from Oklahoma to New Mexico during the Great Depression.

5.caption: A segregated bus station in Durham, North Carolina in 1940.

6.caption: President Roosevelt signs the Social Security Bill, 1935.

7.caption: A booth at the Ohio State Fair in 1937 exhibiting the work of the Ohio FWP.

8.caption: First page of the 1938 memorandum from Couch regarding proposed plans for the life histories.

9.caption: First two pages of the 1938 National Report on the Economic Conditions of the South prepared for President Roosevelt by The National Emergency Council.

10.caption: Letter from Couch to Harris sharing feedback on the life histories method.

11.caption: Graph of Interviewees by Race and Ethnicity.

12.caption: The header of a life history.

13.caption: Table of the top 30 writers by name, gender, and race.

14.caption: The life history of Mary Rumbley conducted by Ida Moore.

15.caption: Life History of Bob Curtis by Jack Kytle.

16.caption: Life history of Matt Wall by Louise Abbitt.

17.caption: From These Are Our Lives, p. 420-421.

18.caption: Photograph of These Are Our Lives displayed in Zibart's Book Store in Tennessee taken by William McDaniel.
